security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate spreadsheet manipulation skill. All static findings are FALSE POSITIVES - the static scanner flagged benign text patterns as security issues. The subprocess calls are to LibreOffice soffice for formula recalculation (hardcoded arguments, no user input). Filesystem access is for Excel file operations and LibreOffice macro setup. No network access, no credential handling, no data exfiltration patterns. Previously audited as low risk with no confirmed issues.

content.user_title: Create and analyze Excel spreadsheets with formulas
content.value_statement: Excel files with formulas lose their calculated values when edited programmatically. This skill provides tools to create, modify, and recalculate Excel spreadsheets while preserving formula integrity and detecting errors.
actual_capabilities: Create new Excel workbooks with formulas, formatting, and styling
Read and analyze data from existing Excel files using pandas
Modify existing spreadsheets while preserving formulas and formatting
Recalculate all formulas in a spreadsheet using LibreOffice
Detect and locate Excel errors like #REF!, #DIV/0!, #VALUE!
Apply color coding and number formatting to spreadsheets
limitations: Requires LibreOffice installation for formula recalculation
Cannot edit password-protected or encrypted Excel files
Cannot directly read very old Excel formats (.xls, .xlsb)
Large files may require read_only mode for performance

use_cases.title: Build financial models
use_cases.description: Create valuation models, budget forecasts, and financial reports with dynamic formulas and error checking.

use_cases.title: Export analysis results
use_cases.description: Export pandas DataFrame analysis to formatted Excel files with formulas for downstream users.

use_cases.title: Automate spreadsheet updates

prompt_templates.title: Create simple spreadsheet
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an Excel file called budget.xlsx with a sheet named Q1 containing columns for Category, Budgeted, and Actual. Add 5 sample expense categories with formulas that calculate variance.

prompt_templates.title: Analyze existing file
prompt_templates.scenario: Read and analyze data from Excel
prompt_templates.prompt: Read the data from sales.xlsx and analyze it with pandas. Show summary statistics and identify any trends in the monthly data.

prompt_templates.title: Update with formulas
prompt_templates.prompt: Update financial_model.xlsx by adding a new row for Q4 projections. Use formulas that reference the Q1-Q3 data. Then recalculate all formulas.

prompt_templates.title: Error detection
prompt_templates.prompt: Check report.xlsx for any Excel errors like #REF! or #DIV/0!. List all error locations by type and suggest fixes for each one.

output_examples.input: Create a simple spreadsheet with budget data

output: Monthly trend: Q1 to Q4 growth of 23%
Top product: Widget Pro with 34% of revenue
Recommendation: Focus marketing on top 3 products

best_practices: Use Excel formulas instead of Python calculations to keep spreadsheets dynamic and updateable
Apply industry-standard color coding: blue for inputs, black for formulas, green for internal links, red for external links
Always recalculate formulas after creating or modifying Excel files before delivering to users
anti_patterns: Hardcoding calculated values instead of using Excel formulas
Opening files with data_only=True and saving, which replaces formulas with static values
Forgetting to run recalc.py after creating or modifying spreadsheets with formulas

faq.question: What Excel formats are supported?
faq.answer: Supports .xlsx, .xlsm, .csv, and .tsv formats. Legacy .xls format requires conversion to .xlsx first.

faq.question: Why do formulas show as text after editing?
faq.answer: openpyxl preserves but does not evaluate formulas. Run recalc.py to calculate all formula values.

faq.question: Is LibreOffice required?
faq.answer: Yes, LibreOffice is required for the recalc.py script to recalculate formulas. Install via package manager or download from libreoffice.org.

faq.question: How does this skill handle sensitive data?
faq.answer: All operations are local. Files are only read from and written to paths you specify. No data is sent to external servers.

faq.question: Why does my file have #REF! errors after editing?
faq.answer: #REF! errors occur when formulas reference cells that were deleted or moved. Check the error locations and update the cell references.

faq.question: How is this different from pandas to_excel?
faq.answer: pandas exports data as static values. openpyxl preserves formulas and formatting. Use pandas for data analysis, openpyxl for spreadsheets with formulas.
